   "source": [
    "# Permafrost Exercise"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "3fbfed3b-2056-4159-848b-cc436b9b58d7",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Permafrost fraction as a function of mean annual air temperature (MAAT)\n",
    "\n",
    "Despite progress in process-based modelling on local and regional scales, a lack of data availability and model limitations cause permafrost still being poorly simulated in global climate models. \n",
    "\n",
    "Large-scale permafrost thaw can be projected using an observation-based relationship (see below) between permafrost probability and mean annual air temperatue (MAAT), statistically accounting for other determining factors such as topography, soil properties, snow and hydrology. Over large spatial scales the probability translates to permafrost fraction. \n",
    "\n",
    "In this exercise, we will apply this relationship to climate model output to explore permafrost occurence in historical periods and in future climate scenarios."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "id": "0e256140-f662-4e25-a2b3-829fde528582",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Import python packages\n",
    "import xarray as xr\n",
    "import pandas as pd\n",
    "import matplotlib as mpl\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "import cartopy.crs as ccrs\n",
    "import cartopy.feature as cf\n",
    "import scipy\n",
    "from glob import glob\n",
    "\n",
    "%matplotlib inline\n",
    "\n",
    "# constants\n",
    "fp = 273.15 # freezing point in K"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "id": "c956c8d3-f284-4f8a-bd90-45ba48f39506",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Relationship Permafrost Fraction and MAAT (Gruber 2012)\n",
    "def PF(MAAT, mu, sigma):\n",
    "    PF = 0.5 * scipy.special.erfc( (MAAT+mu)/(2*sigma**2)**0.5 )\n",
    "    return PF\n",
    "    \n",
    "# from Chadburn et al. (2017)\n",
    "mu_chad = 4.38\n",
    "sigma_chad = (2.59)**0.5 \n",
    "mu_max_chad = 3.05\n",
    "sigma_max_chad = (4.97)**0.5 \n",
    "mu_min_chad = 6.53\n",
    "sigma_min_chad = (5.57)**0.5"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 5,
   "id": "82314235-2e6a-443a-aa9d-c529284d219b",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "Text(0.5, 1.0, ' ')"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 5,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 640x480 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# inspect relationship\n",
    "MAAT = np.linspace(-18,16)\n",
    "\n",
    "mylinewidth=1\n",
    "mylinestyle='--'\n",
    "\n",
    "mycolor1='black'\n",
    "plt.plot(MAAT, PF(MAAT,mu_chad, sigma_chad), color = mycolor1,linewidth=mylinewidth,label = 'norm variant')\n",
    "plt.plot(MAAT, PF(MAAT,mu_min_chad, sigma_min_chad), color = 'green', linewidth=mylinewidth,linestyle=mylinestyle, label = 'warm variant')\n",
    "plt.plot(MAAT, PF(MAAT,mu_max_chad, sigma_max_chad), color = 'blue',linewidth=mylinewidth,linestyle=mylinestyle, label = 'cold variant')\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.legend()\n",
    "plt.grid()\n",
    "plt.xlabel('Mean annual air temperature [deg C]')\n",
    "plt.ylabel('Permafrost fraction')\n",
    "plt.ylim((-0.1,1.1))\n",
    "plt.title(' ')"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "0a9d582a-42ec-4310-a33c-cbec144bf7b8",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [

   "source": [
    "**Task: Categorize the different permafrost zones**<br>\n",
    "Apply the following mask to the obtained permafrost fraction.<br>\n",
    "0-0.1 : no or isolated permafrost <br>\n",
    "0.1-0.5: sporadic permafrost <br>\n",
    "0.5-0.9: discontinuous permafrost <br>\n",
    "0.9-1 : continuous permafrost<br>\n",
    "\n",
    "Display the output and discuss it with your neighbour. What is surpring to you? Can you think of limitations of this method and and it's input data from NorESM2-MM? Where can we not trust the map?"

  {

   "id": "e3b09660-2d46-4008-b8fd-e6e43346ee8b",
   "metadata": {
    "scrolled": true
   },
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# IPA permafrost masks none/isolated - sporadic -discontinuous - continuous \n",
    "PF_mask = xr.where( PF_cont <= 0.1, 0, float('nan'))\n",
    "PF_mask = xr.where( PF_cont > 0.1, 1, PF_mask)\n",
    "PF_mask = xr.where( PF_cont > 0.5, 2, PF_mask)\n",
    "PF_mask = xr.where( PF_cont > 0.9 , 3, PF_mask)\n",
    "PF_mask = PF_mask.rename('permafrost zones')"
   ]
